generif.text: Overexpression of p28/gankyrin in HCC plays an important role and contributes to the metastasis potential in the process of carcinogenesis.
MAGE-A4 binds to gankyrin and suppresses its oncogenic activity.
gankyrin interactions with partner proteins are mediated by residues situated on its concave surface
X-ray structure of gankyrin.
The hepatocytic staining for p28(GANK) is clearly useful in differentiating hepatocyte-originated carcinoma from non-HCC. p28(GANK) may be used as an ancillary marker for the diagnosis of HCC.
Structural comparison with p16(INK4A) identified several residues of gankyrin that are potentially important for CDK4 binding
role of p28GANK as a highly expressed oncoprotein in hepatocellular carcinoma by in situ examination

Results allow the dissection of the "protein-protein binding" and "CDK4 inhibition" functions of P16, show that the difference between tumor suppressing and oncogenic functions of P16 and gankyrin, respectively, mainly resides in a single residue.
Results suggest that gankyrin binds to NF-kappaB and suppresses its activity at the transcription level by modulating acetylation via SIRT1.
Gankyrin oncoprotein has a role in progression of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma
These results suggest that overexpression of p28(GANK) prevents the nuclear localization and inhibits the activity of NF-kappaB/RelA.
gankyrin plays an oncogenic role mainly at the early stages of human hepatocarcinogenesis.
Rb antagonizes gankyrin to inhibit MDM2-mediate p53 ubiquitination in cancer cells and suggest that the status of both p53 and Rb is important for efficacy of cancer chemotherapy.
p28GANK knockdown-derived reactive oxygen species induces apoptosis through mitochondrial dysfunction mediated by p38
Overexpression of a new gene P28GANK confers multidrug resistance of gastric cancer cells.
The results of this study demonstrate that gankyrin overexpression downregulates p53 expression and promotes cell proliferation in a zebrafish model.
The overexpression of multidrug resistance-associated proteins and gankyrin contribute to arsenic trioxide resistance in liver and gastric cancer cells.
p28GANK-knockdown induces the generation of reactive oxygen species (ROS), which in turn activates p38.
p28(GANK) has potential implications for hepatocellular carcinoma progression under the endoplasmic reticulum stress conditions
Gankyrin was overexpressed in colorectal cancer tissues and cell lines compared to controls, and gankyrin expression was correlated with TNM stages and metastasis of CRC.
analysis of how gankyrin unfolds under force via multiple distinct pathways
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Gankyrin could enhance pancreatic cancer cell proliferation by promoting cell cycle progression and p53 degradation.
Gankyrin is a key regulator of Ras-mediated activation of Akt through inhibition of the downstream RhoA/ROCK pathway and thus plays an essential role in Ras-induced tumorigenesis.

we detected a significant correlation between p28(GANK) expression and p-AKT levels in a cohort of hepatocellular carcinoma biopsies, and the combination of these two parameters is a more powerful predictor of poor prognosis.

these findings suggest that down-regulation of P28GANK gene expression could sensitize osteosarcoma cells to chemotherapeutic drugs by down-regulation of the MDR-1 and Bcl-2 and up-regulation of Bax gene expression.
Upregulation of p28(GANK) expression subsequently enhanced the transcription activity of beta-catenin.
Gankyrin overexpression is a prevalent event in human oral cancer and occurs during the early stages of oral carcinogenesis, thus being a viable therapeutic or chemopreventive target in oral cancer
Knockdown of HURP inhibits the proliferation of hepacellular carcinoma cells via downregulation of gankyrin and accumulation of p53.
findings suggest that Gankyrin is crucial for breast cancer metastasis
the roles and underlying mechanisms by which gankyrin is involved in tumorigenesis and cancer metastasis
Increased expression of p28GANK is correlated with glioma.
Data indicate that miR-214 down-regulated the expression of PSMD10 (gankyrin) and ASF1B, and gankyrin inhibition induced an increase of P53 mRNA levels.

gankyrin was identified in normal breasts and overexpressed in invasive breast cancers. The overexpression of gankyrin was associated with extensive intraductal carcinoma and ErbB2 expression in breast cancer.
In colorectal cancer development, gankyrin would control stem cell behavior by regulating the expression of stemness factors.
Activation of the interleukin (IL)-8 signaling pathway by Gankyrin.
Gankyrin is crucial for cholangiocarcinoma carcinogenesis and metastasis by activating IL-6/STAT3 signaling pathway through down-regulating Rb protein.
Gankyrin deletion abrogated the increased metastatic potential of breast cancer cells under hypoxic conditions partly through regulating Ecadherin.
The intensity of gankyrin expression was 'positive' in two cases (20%) and 'strongly positive' in eight cases (80%).
Gankyrin may be functional in cervical carcinogenesis and metastasis.
Gankyrin is aberrantly expressed beginning at the initiation stage and plays an important role in the initiation, promotion, and progression of hepatocarcinogenesis.
MiR-605 directly targets and represses PSMD10 expression.

This study identifies gankyrin, for the first time, as new potential predictive and oncogenic factor of well-differentiated/dedifferentiated liposarcoma, suggesting the potential for service as a future Liposarcoma therapeutic approach.
IL-1beta stimulation causes sequential phosphorylation of IRAK-1, c-Jun N-terminal kinase, and p300 and enhances recruitment of the p300/CBP/NF-Y complex to Gankyrin promoter
p28GANK expression was increased in metastatic ESCC tissues and cells, and p28GANK knockdown decreased the metastatic ability of ESCC cells.
On the base results of present study one can suggests the p28GANK being useful as a predictive marker for patient prognosis and a novel therapeutic target for gastric cancer.
PSMD10/gankyrin has a role in inducing autophagy to promote tumor progression through cytoplasmic interaction with ATG7 and nuclear transactivation of ATG7 expression
gankyrin regulates HIF-1alpha protein stability and cyclin D1 expression, ultimately mediating FSH-driven ovarian cancer cell proliferation

Results identified rs111638916 SNP in the PSMD10 3'-UTR as a risk factor for gastric cancer (GC) and acted as a tumor promoting factor. SNP rs111638916 was also regulated by miR-505, resulting in its up-regulation in patients with GA and AA genotypes.
Gankyrin-overexpressed non-small cell lung cancer patients had a significantly shorter survival time

Gankyrin is an oncoprotein that facilitates the degradation of two key tumor suppressors, namely, Rb and p53. Gankyrin is involved in the regulation of cell signaling pathways, with particular reference to RhoA/ROCK/PTEN/PI3K/Akt, beta-catenin, IL-6/STAT3, and IL-1beta/IRAK-1 inflammatory signaling. Review.
Gankyrin overexpression activates mTORC1 signaling and accelerating TSC2 degradation in colorectal tumor cells.
gankyrin is an oncoprotein that can be modified by small molecules in tumor cell lines

The positive feedback regulation involving gankyrin and Nrf2 modulates a series of antioxidant enzymes, thereby lowering intracellular ROS and conferring a steadier intracellular environment, which prevents mitochondrial damage and cell death induced by excessive oxidative stress.
Gankyrin sustains PI3K/GSK-3beta/beta-catenin signal activation and promotes an aggressive colorectal cancer phenotype and disease progression.

we conclude that FXR-Gank-TSPs-Stem cells pathway is a key determinant of liver cancer in animal models and in pediatric liver cancer. Our data provide a strong basis for development of FXR-Gank-based therapy for treatment of patients with hepatoblastoma
Gankyrin is mainly overexpressed in high grade prostate tumors so it may have a significant role in prostate cancer progress

Gankyrin enhanced gastric cancer cell proliferation by regulating cell cycle-related proteins and by activating PI3K/AKT signaling pathway. Gankyrin played an important role in gastric carcinogenesis and could be a potential effective therapeutic target for enhancing chemosensitivity to 5-fluorouracil and cisplatin.

the results demonstrated that the lentivirus-mediated shRNA vector-based RNAi expression system is an efficient method to silence PSMD10 gene expression in the MM RPMI-8226 cell line. It may provide a basis to study the role of PSMD10 in tumor cells, and may be a reliable gene therapy strategy in the clinic

p28 assists the proteolytic core particle to select a specific conformation of the ATPase ring for regulatory particle engagement and is released in a shoehorn-like fashion in the last step of the chaperone-mediated proteasome assembly.
Low Gankyrin expression is associated with drug resistance in Breast Cancer.
the pro-malignant effects of Gankyrin in CRC cells

KIFC1 induced epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition and HCC metastasis both in vitro and in vivo. This tumorigenic effect depended on gankyrin; inhibiting gankyrin activity reversed EMT via activation of TWIST1.
miR-214 functions as a tumor suppressor in PTC cells by targeting PSMD10, suggesting that it may be a potential target for the treatment of PTC.
gankyrin alleviates oxidative stress via mTORC1 pathway activation.

Results uncovered that Gankyrin functions as an essential regulator in glycolysis and glutaminolysis via activation of beta-catenin/c-Myc to promotes tumorigenesis, metastasis and drug resistance in human hepatocellular carcinoma.

38 (72%) colorectal cancer (CRC) patients had increased gankyrin expression in tumor cells. The enhanced gankyrin expression in tumor cells was associated with unfavorable progression-free survival and could serve as a biomarker to predict therapeutic response in patients with metastatic CRC.

Study demonstrates that the expression of gankyrin is positively associated with disease progression, metastasis, sunitinib-resistance and poor prognosis of renal cell carcinoma (RCC) patients. Moreover, gankyrin expression is an independent risk factor for overall survival and progression-free survival of RCC patients.
Gankyrin promotes osteosarcoma tumorigenesis by forming a positive feedback loop with YAP.
Increased Expression of Gankyrin and Stemness Factor Oct-4 are Associated with Unfavorable Clinical Outcomes and Poor Benefit of Tamoxifen in Breast Carcinoma Patients.
findings revealed that miR-3619-5p inhibits cancer cell proliferation by targeting PSMD10, and miR-3619-5p as a potential therapeutic target for the treatment of liver cancer
SMARCA4 oncogenic potential via IRAK1 enhancer to activate Gankyrin and AKR1B10 in liver cancer.
Helicobacter pylori and Epstein-Barr Virus Coinfection Stimulates Aggressiveness in Gastric Cancer through the Regulation of Gankyrin.
Hsa-miR-1248 suppressed the proliferation, invasion and migration of colorectal cancer cells via inhibiting PSMD10.
miR-188-5p and Host MALAT1 Regulate RBE Cell Migration, Invasion, and Apoptosis via Up-regulating PSMD10 in Cholangiocarcinoma.
Gankyrin-mediated interaction between cancer cells and tumor-associated macrophages facilitates prostate cancer progression and androgen deprivation therapy resistance.

summary: This gene encodes a subunit of the PA700/19S complex, which is the regulatory component of the 26S proteasome. The 26S proteosome complex is required for ubiquitin-dependent protein degradation. This protein is a non-ATPase subunit that may be involved in protein-protein interactions. Aberrant expression of this gene may paly a role in tumorigenesis. Two transcripts encoding different isoforms have been described. Pseudogenes have been identified on chromosomes 3 and 20.[provided by RefSeq, Mar 2011].
